data.title: The Spaghetti Western Database
data.text:
Giubbe rosse (Italy 1975 / Director: Aristide Massaccesi)

Synopsis

Set in the great Canadian wilderness, two men, a Mountie (Cormack) and an outlaw (Caribou) who were once close, have become enemies. Caribou kidnaps Cormack's son, hoping to lure him into a trap, but matters are complicated by the presence of a gold hungry gang of robbers.

Credits

Cast (Italian): Fabio Testi (Corporal Bill Cormack), Guido Mannari (Caribou), Wendy Deborah D’Olive (Shee-Noa), Claudio Undari [as Robert Hundar] (Wolf Seattle), Lars Bloch (Andy O'Brien), Daniele Dublino (lieutenant), Geoffrey Copleston (RMP Commander), Bruno Corazzari (Logan, bandit), Paolo Magalotti (Curt, trapper), Luigi Antonio Guerra (Wolf henchman), Aldo Cecconi (Rick, Wolf henchman), Lynne Frederick (Elizabeth), Renato Cestiè (Jimmy), Lionel Stander (Doctor Higgins)

Uncredited actors: Lucio Montanaro (Monkey), Luciano Zanussi (bank telegraphist), Franco Ricci (priest), Renzo Pevarello (Wolf henchman), Umberto Santolamazza (Wolf henchman), Massimo Ciprari (Wolf henchman), Emilio Messina (safe robber), Angelo Boscariol (trapper), Arnaldo Dell'Acqua (trapper), Angelo Casadei (trading post customer), Vincenzo De Palo (saloon patron)

Director: Aristide Massaccesi [as Joe D'Amato]

Story: Claudio Bernabei, Joe D'Amato (Aristide Massaccesi)

Screenplay: Claudio Bernabei, Joe D'Amato (Aristide Massaccesi), Luigi Montefiori [as George Eastman]

Cinematography: Joe D'Amato (Aristide Massaccesi) [Technicolor - widescreen]

Music: Carlo Rustichelli

Song: “Day After Day” sung by Lynne Frederick

Producer: Alfonso Donati
